definition[0]: to make a statement, report etc less forceful by changing it or removing parts that may offend people – used to show disapproval
example[0]: The report of the investigation had been watered down.
definition[1]: to add water to a drink to make it less strong
definition[2]: to make a suggestion, rule, or proposal less forceful by removing some parts of it
example[1]: A late amendment watered down the insider-trading penalties to a £100,000 maximum fine instead of the earlier £500,000.
